intro: Iozoste multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered iozoste, is a herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It features slender, branched stems that often grow close to the ground. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Iozoste multiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
